p: In addition, precipitation patterns may also greatly affect the development of pathogenic fungal disease, as an excess or scarcity of relative air humidity is required by most fungal infections ( Steffenson, 2003). It is possible to find pathogen response enriched GO terms in the genes of the R. mangle network, such as “defense response” (GO: 0006952) in cluster 11 of the stems and cluster 147 of the leaves. The upregulation of genes involved in the response to pathogens in equatorial samples is related to high temperatures that provide a favorable environment for the growth of stem and leaf fungi.
